node.title: The warnings were ominous, but just how did Mark McGowan use his party's total control of WA's parliament?
node.alt: A middle aged man wearing blue suit, white shirt and patterned tie standing in front of light yellow wall.
node.description: When Labor took full control of the WA Parliament in a historic election this year, the warnings from the opposition were ominous, so howÂ has the first year of an extraordinary parliament awash with Labor MPs played out?
node.content:
["When Labor took full control of the WA parliament in a historic election this year, the warnings from the opposition were ominous.", "It would be \"dangerous for the future of our state,\" declared\u00a0former opposition leader Zak Kirkup.", "So how has the first year of an extraordinary parliament awash with Labor MPs played out?", "It's no surprise\u00a0the McGowan government used its numbers in both houses to press ahead with its legislative agenda.", "
No mandate for electoral reform
", "In his final sitting week for the parliamentary year, the Premier proudly listed off the laws his government had passed this year.", "The first he mentioned was the one the state government had no mandate to introduce.", "", "
Before the electoral changes, half of all WA's upper house seats were allocated to\u00a0the 25 per cent of West Australians who live outside of Perth.(AAP: Richard Wainwright)
", "Despite Mr McGowan repeatedly stating electoral reform was \"not on the agenda\" throughout the state election campaign, Labor wasted no time enacting the party's long-held dream.", "\"I am very pleased to see that we have passed legislation to ensure that the Legislative Council of Western Australia is democratic for the first time in 130 years,\" Mr McGowan told parliament.", "
'Governments \u2026 are elected to make decisions'
", "One reform the government had both a mandate and broad support for was the better protection of Aboriginal heritage.", "\"After three decades of failed attempts, we will be delivering our new Aboriginal Cultural Heritage Act to ensure that Aboriginal heritage is improved and at the forefront of considerations when projects are developed,\" Mr McGowan told parliament.", "", "
Mark McGowan's government used its\u00a0numbers to push\u00a0ahead with its legislative agenda.(ABC News: Andrew O'Connor)
", "But the opposition argued the new Aboriginal heritage laws were being rammed through \u2014\u00a0despite concern from Indigenous leaders who feared it would not go far enough to prevent another Juukan Gorge.", "Labor introduced the bill, which had more than 100 changes to the draft legislation, in its second-last sitting week.", "It declared the bill was urgent and ensured there would be extra time for the upper house to pass it this year.", "This move, the opposition argued, was an example of the government misusing its numbers.", "\"How can the Premier justify bringing on a bill of 353 clauses and with more than 100 changes from the draft, when it was made public only hours earlier?\" Nationals MP Vince Catania asked Mr McGowan\u00a0in parliament.", "", "
Nationals MP Vince Catania argued\u00a0the\u00a0Aboriginal Cultural Heritage Act was being rushed through parliament.(ABC Pilbara: Laura Birch)
", "The Premier\u00a0argued\u00a0it was urgent reform and a problem that previous governments had failed to fix.", "\"My view is that governments are elected to act, they are elected to make decisions and they are elected to improve things, and that is what this legislation will do,\" Mr McGowan said.", "In the first year of its second term of government, the McGowan government\u00a0also passed ticket scalping legislation, safe access zones for women around abortion clinics, and security of payment laws for subcontractors.", "All of that happened with a pandemic backdrop \u2013 including taking the extraordinary step of mandating vaccination for 75 per cent of the state's workforce.", "
A seating plan headache\u00a0and other first world problems
", "Question Time in Western Australia's Legislative Assembly is not what it used to be.", "These days, it is kind of reminiscent of a schoolyard in which 53 kids have encircled a group of six of their peers for a game of dodgeball.", "", "
Labor has a majority in both houses of parliament.(ABC News)
", "On the final sitting day in the Legislative Assembly this year, WA Premier Mark McGowan summed up how the schoolyard \u2014\u00a0packed with Labor MPs\u00a0\u2014 tends to work.", "\"It [the Labor majority] has created a few first world problems for me,\" he teased.", "\"It was problematic working out the seating plan for you [opposition].", "\"I obviously upset some of our [Labor] members, because sometimes in full flight, we will yell that,\u00a0'those opposite are useless' or,\u00a0'those opposite are hopeless', and we are looking at all our own MPs!\"", "", "
Take a look back at the historic 2021 WA election campaign.
", "Jokes aside, a strong opposition is fundamental to strong government.", "As Opposition Leader Mia Davies pointed out in parliament this week, the six non-government MPs of the lower house have turned up every week to ask questions on behalf of their communities.", "\"We tried to provide balance and scrutiny to a government that has an enormous amount of power,\" she told parliament.", "\"\u2026 We saw this government being opportunistic about its priorities and ensure that it could get through its very important political priorities, including the electoral reform legislation.\"", "", "
Mia Davies says opposition MPs have been working hard to provide balance\u00a0and scrutiny in parliament.(ABC News: Rhiannon Shine)
", "Promised law reform around superannuation splitting for de facto couples was one example, Ms Davies argued, of law reform which should have been given priority over electoral reform \u2014 something that will not affect anyone until 2025.", "
'They could have gone harder with their numbers'
", "The Leader of the Opposition in the Legislative Council, Liberal MP Steve Thomas, was less scathing of Labor's first year in total control of the parliament.", "\"The sheer weight of numbers, at the end of the day, just crushes us,\" Mr Thomas said.", "\"But they could have gone harder with their numbers.\"", "Mr Thomas referenced an Upper House committee, which Labor allowed to be chaired by a Liberal and have a non-government majority, as an example of this.", "", "
Steve Thomas says the opposition gets crushed by the \"sheer weight\" of the government's numbers.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "\"We have got some compromise, but it's all at the government's whim,\" he said.", "\"The upper house has retained its role of review and accountability.", "\"Despite the numbers, we continue to scrutinise.\"", "The upper house will sit for another three weeks to do exactly that \u2013 debate and scrutinise the final pieces of legislation for this year \u2013 which will, of course, inevitably pass."]
